source: I thought that writing an article on my favourite sport would be interesting for the readers. Above all, and making no differences of the sport you have chosen, it is paramount to do some sport, whatever sport you choose, such as spinning. That is my favourite sport.
corrected: I thought that writing an article on my favourite sport would be interesting for the readers. Above all, and regardless of the sport you have chosen, it is paramount to do some sport, whatever sport you choose, such as spinning. That is my favourite sport.
feedback_explanation: "Making no differences of" does not sound natural here.
feedback_suggestion: Try using another term such as "regardless of."

source: I'm a cheerful person, so I would attempt to give my best for keep the attention of the children.
corrected: I'm a cheerful person, so I would attempt to give my best to keep the attention of the children.
feedback_explanation: You can't use "for keep" to express purpose. Purpose clauses typically use a phrase with a to-infinitive or a that clause.
feedback_suggestion: Consider changing "for" to "to" to change this into a to-infinitive.

source: Parents' words is key to restricting their kids' actions.
corrected: Parents' words are key to restricting their kids' actions.
feedback_explanation: "Words" is plural, but "is" is only used with a singular subject.
feedback_suggestion: Change "is" to a form that goes with a plural subject.

source: Except for [NONE] the big cities, public transport is not an easy way to get around the city. That means that in the future even more people will stop using it.
corrected: Except for in the big cities, public transport is not an easy way to get around the city. That means that in the future even more people will stop using it.
feedback_explanation: You need a prepositional phrase or adverb to express where something is true or where something happens.
feedback_suggestion: Add "in" before "the big cities" to focus on how things are there.

source: When Michael woke up that morning he smelled a strange smell in the air. He did not know what what the source of that strange smell was but, in his nose, he received a kind of sign something bad [NONE] happened.
corrected: When Michael woke up that morning he smelled a strange smell in the air. He did not know what what the source of that strange smell was but, in his nose, he received a kind of sign something bad had happened.
feedback_explanation: When we talk about two past events, we use "had" before the verb of the earlier event. This is called the past perfect tense.
feedback_suggestion: Add "had" before "happened" to make it past perfect.

source: I miss you so much. How are your baby?
corrected: I miss you so much. How is your baby?
feedback_explanation: The subject, "your baby" is in the third person singular. The verb must be in a different form to match with it.
feedback_suggestion: Change "are" to a form that goes with a third-person singular subject.

source: clothes trends changes very quickly.
corrected: clothes trends change very quickly.
feedback_explanation: Your subject and verb do not agree in number. "Clothes trends" is plural, but "changes" is only used with a singular subject.
feedback_suggestion: Change "changes" to a form that goes with a plural subject.

source: Taichung have plenty of trees in the park.
corrected: Taichung has plenty of trees in the park.
feedback_explanation: The subject, "Taichung" is in the third person singular. The verb must be in a different form to match with it.
feedback_suggestion: Change "have" to a form that goes with a third-person singular subject.

source: In purpose to build more necessary networks of housing and transport, areas of farmland, forest and wetland have to be destroyed by many countries today.
corrected: In order to build more necessary networks of housing and transport, areas of farmland, forest and wetland have to be destroyed by many countries today.
feedback_explanation: "In purpose to" is not a valid way to form a purpose clause in English.
feedback_suggestion: Edit this to use a standard purpose clause phrase such as "to," "in order to," and "so as to."

source: It says the bravery of men is reckoned by the number of scars on his body, except on his back, because they thought to be dead on the field was far better than retreating.
corrected: It says the bravery of a man is reckoned by the number of scars on his body, except on his back, because they thought to be dead on the field was far better than retreating.
feedback_explanation: "Men" is plural here, but you seem to be talking about one at a time. Use a singular form instead.
feedback_suggestion: Change "men" to be singular.

source: Nowadays, many accident happen when people are driving their cars.
corrected: Nowadays, many accidents happen when people are driving their cars.
feedback_explanation: "Accident" is singular here, but you seem to be talking about more than one.
feedback_suggestion: Change "accident" to be plural.

source: Michael went into the teacher's office, but he found that his teacher wasn't there. Maybe the teacher had gone to the bathroom. Suddenly, the door is opened by a teacher, a teacher who was wearing a bikini came into sight. This incident came as quite a surprise to Michael. She flirted with Michael. Michael felt excited but ran out of the office, but he regretted his action. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.
corrected: Michael went into the teacher's office, but he found that his teacher wasn't there. Maybe the teacher had gone to the bathroom. Suddenly, the door was opened by a teacher, a teacher who was wearing a bikini came into sight. This incident came as quite a surprise to Michael. She flirted with Michael. Michael felt excited but ran out of the office, but he regretted his action. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.
feedback_explanation: To use a passive verb in the past tense, it is necessary to use the pattern "was"/"were" plus the past participle.
feedback_suggestion: Change "is" to "was" to fix this past passive.

source: I think one of my favorite sports of all is athletics. I love it because it is a sport where you prove yourself, you have to be better every day than you were yesterday. It force you to improve every time. Also, it is an exercise that helps your whole body, especially the legs, because it gives them great strength, but also your hands, because they have to be in constant movement, and all the body in general, because you run and your metabolism is accommodated and helps you to have coordination.
corrected: I think one of my favorite sports of all is athletics. I love it because it is a sport where you prove yourself, you have to be better every day than you were yesterday. It forces you to improve every time. Also, it is an exercise that helps your whole body, especially the legs, because it gives them great strength, but also your hands, because they have to be in constant movement, and all the body in general, because you run and your metabolism is accommodated and helps you to have coordination.
feedback_explanation: The subject, "it," is in the third person singular. The verb must be in a different form to match with it.
feedback_suggestion: Change "force" to a form that goes with a third-person singular subject.

source: I think this thriller will get your nerves out of you. The movie reveals many things as it continues. It's actually so good and, for those that are scared of thrillers, this movie is more like suspense and I really think you can enjoy it.
corrected: I think this thriller will get your nerves out of you. The movie reveals many things as it continues. It's actually so good and, for those who are scared of thrillers, this movie is more like suspense and I really think you can enjoy it.
feedback_explanation: Using "that" as a relative pronoun for people may sound informal.
feedback_suggestion: Consider changing "that" to "who."

source: . You can experience 19th century Korean imperial architecture and Korean traditional custom.
corrected: . You can experience 19th century Korean imperial architecture and Korean traditional customs.
feedback_explanation: "Custom" is singular here, but it is better to refer to more than one.
feedback_suggestion: Change "custom" to be plural.

source: I am communicating with you with the purpose of letting yo know that we are going to set up a meeting at my office with the purpose of discussing how we could use social media to improve the communication with our suppliers. I think a great time for the meeting would be next Monday at 4:00 p.m
corrected: I am communicating with you with the purpose of letting you know that we are going to set up a meeting at my office with the purpose of discussing how we could use social media to improve the communication with our suppliers. I think a great time for the meeting would be next Monday at 4:00 p.m
feedback_explanation: This word may be misspelled.
feedback_suggestion: Did you mean "you?"

source: In important meetings like the UN General Assembly or G77, many leaders of power countries raise environmental problems as the most concerning problem in their internal policies.
corrected: In important meetings like the UN General Assembly or G77, many leaders of powerful countries raise environmental problems as the most concerning problem in their internal policies.
feedback_explanation: The word "power" is a noun, but we need an adjective to modify a noun like "countries."
feedback_suggestion: Change "power" to an adjective like "powerful."

source: In my opinion, public transport has been improved over the last years, because cities have been putting a lot of investment into that.
corrected: In my opinion, public transport has been improved over the last years, because cities have been putting a lot of investment into it.
feedback_explanation: If you are talking about "public transportation" again, the word "that" is not the best choice. "That" is used for something specific that feels far away, but "public transportation" is already clear here.
feedback_suggestion: Change "that" to "it" to make this more clear.

source: I think that for people who want learning English Write and Improve is great!
corrected: I think that for people who want to learn English Write and Improve is great!
feedback_explanation: "Want" needs a to-infinitive (to + base form of the verb) here, but "learning" is the wrong form.
feedback_suggestion: Change "learning" to a to-infinitive.

source: Under these circumstances, some people may prefer to take public transport to save money for their 'dream house' rather than buying a car.
corrected: Under these circumstances, some people may prefer to take public transport to save money for their 'dream house' rather than buy a car.
feedback_explanation: When comparing actions with "prefer," you can choose a to-infinitive (to + base form) or a gerund (-ing). Both actions have to use the same form, but yours are different.
feedback_suggestion: Consider changing "buying" to the to-infinitive so that it matches "to take."

source: There are a lot of clubs, pubs and bars, cafe, and karaoke, bars and it has more facilities which you will be able to enjoy.
corrected: There are a lot of clubs, pubs and bars, cafes, and karaoke, bars and it has more facilities which you will be able to enjoy.
feedback_explanation: "Cafe" is singular here, but you seem to be talking about more than one.
feedback_suggestion: Change "cafe" to be plural.

source: Then our trainer, Nico, shows us a lot [NONE] tips and tricks.
corrected: Then our trainer, Nico, shows us a lot of tips and tricks.
feedback_explanation: "A lot" is always followed by "of" when talking about the amount of something countable like "tips and tricks."
feedback_suggestion: Change "a lot" to "a lot of."

source: The story of Blade Runner is about a police officer named Dickard who is working as a killer for the most dangerous robots on earth, which they called the replicants, and they are dangerous to humans.
corrected: The story of Blade Runner is about a police officer named Dickard who is working as a killer for the most dangerous robots on earth, which they call the replicants, and they are dangerous to humans.
feedback_explanation: "Called" is in the past tense, but it is better to use a present verb in this context.
feedback_suggestion: Change "called" to the present tense.

source: We at Madhura Nagar, understand the need to protecting the environment and hence are committed to what we do.
corrected: We at Madhura Nagar, understand the need to protect the environment and hence are committed to what we do.
feedback_explanation: "Need" needs a to-infinitive (to + base form of the verb) here, but "to protecting" is the wrong form.
feedback_suggestion: Change "protecting" to the base form to fix this infinitive.

source: First, classes with discussion between professor and student had an advantage for the students because they learn how to interact with their fellow students.
corrected: First, classes with discussion between professor and student have an advantage for the students because they learn how to interact with their fellow students.
feedback_explanation: "Had" is in the past tense, but you seem to be speaking in general about how things are. A present tense is more appropriate.
feedback_suggestion: Change "had" to the present tense.

source: Sometimes, this can change a person, making that her or him have a new perception of the world.
corrected: Sometimes, this can change a person, making [NONE] her or him have a new perception of the world.
feedback_explanation: When using "make" to describe something causing another to do an action, the pattern "make + person/thing + verb (base form)" is used.
feedback_suggestion: Remove "that" to make this follow the causative pattern.
highlight_text: making that her or him have

source: Second, for the indoor swimming pool, it generally appear wavy falling, from 2500 dollars in 2012 to 2000 dollars in 2014. We can infer, it will not rise sharply, and it is impossible for it to fall sharply.
corrected: Second, for the indoor swimming pool, it generally appears to be wavy falling, from 2500 dollars in 2012 to 2000 dollars in 2014. We can infer, it will not rise sharply, and it is impossible for it to fall sharply.
feedback_explanation: Words like "seem" and "appear" can not connect to an -ing verb directly.
feedback_suggestion: Use the infinitive "to be" as a connector.

source: Peschiera Borromeo, a small town near Milan, has an agricultural reality and there are many possibilities for walking around and to training yourself for doing parcour.
corrected: Peschiera Borromeo, a small town near Milan, has an agricultural reality and there are many possibilities for walking around and [NONE] training yourself for doing parcour.
feedback_explanation: It seems this is supposed to be the gerund form of the verb "train." Gerunds are the same as the -ing form of a verb. You don't need additional words like "to."
feedback_suggestion: Remove the unnecessary "to."

source: We gathering around the table on this day and wait for the spring in the last moments of the year.
corrected: We gather around the table on this day and wait for the spring in the last moments of the year.
feedback_explanation: When describing something you usually do, use the simple present, not the present continuous.
feedback_suggestion: Change "gathering" to the simple present form.

source: Ten year ago, the local governing body of the city decided to plant more tree and it asked advice from the citizens of the city about the proposal.
corrected: Ten year ago, the local governing body of the city decided to plant more trees and it asked advice from the citizens of the city about the proposal.
feedback_explanation: "Tree" is singular here, but you are talking about a situation with more than one.
feedback_suggestion: Change "tree" to be plural.

source: So I have had a lot [NONE] problems:
corrected: So I have had a lot of problems:
feedback_explanation: "A lot" is always followed by "of" when talking about the amount of something countable like "problems."
feedback_suggestion: Change "a lot" to "a lot of."

source: More accurate surgery, emotional bond and an increase in communication are examples of positive consequences.
corrected: More accurate surgery, emotional bonding and an increase in communication are examples of positive consequences.
feedback_explanation: "Emotional bond" is not quite correct here. It means a specific connection that has already been made.
feedback_suggestion: Try changing this to "emotional bonding," which means the process of making emotional bonds.

source: Sukh was so angry with him because he hurt her a lot. Sukh refused to give him her laptop and her brother start fighting with her again and he even slapped his sister.
corrected: Sukh was so angry with him because he hurt her a lot. Sukh refused to give him her laptop and her brother started fighting with her again and he even slapped his sister.
feedback_explanation: To talk about something that happened in the past, use the past tense of the verb.
feedback_suggestion: Change "start" to the past tense.

source: Every human being has a need in socialising and that is the first reason why I believe we start making friends.
corrected: Every human being has a need for socialising and that is the first reason why I believe we start making friends.
feedback_explanation: "A need" can't be followed by "in" like this.
feedback_suggestion: Change "in" to "for" to fix this expression.

source: Talking about your new job, I was searching for some vacancies. However, they required a full - time worker, so I am going to continue searching for some jobs of part - time.
corrected: Talking about your new job, I was searching for some vacancies. However, they required a full - time worker, so I am going to continue searching for some part - time jobs.
feedback_explanation: "Jobs of part time" does not sound natural.
feedback_suggestion: It is better to say "part-time jobs."

source: Our budget is fixed for only 75 people, it is almost twice the number of participants last year.
corrected: Our budget is fixed for only 75 people, which is almost twice the number of participants last year.
feedback_explanation: This is a relative clause to explain more about something. You can't use "it" here - a relative pronoun is needed instead.
feedback_suggestion: Change "it" to a relative pronoun.

source: Finally, the kind of life that we will see in fifty years from now will have a lot of stuff to help people to have a more comfortable, easier and faster way of life, but this will be only to make more money and consume more and more. Also, things will be faster of waste to make people to change their possessions more often and stimulate consumerism.
corrected: Finally, the kind of life that we will see in fifty years from now will have a lot of stuff to help people to have a more comfortable, easier and faster way of life, but this will be only to make more money and consume more and more. Also, things will be faster of waste to make people [NONE] change their possessions more often and stimulate consumerism.
feedback_explanation: When using "make" to describe something causing another to do an action, the pattern "make + person/thing + verb (base form)" is used.
feedback_suggestion: Remove "to" to make this satisfy the causative pattern.

source: In other ways I'll talk about Benzema. He is my friend for many years, but I'm not sure if he is with me or with the others guys, so I want to listen to their version of the story so he is here to talk about that.
corrected: In other ways I'll talk about Benzema. He has been my friend for many years, but I'm not sure if he is with me or with the others guys, so I want to listen to their version of the story so he is here to talk about that.
feedback_explanation: When you talk about something that started in the past and continues until now, it is necessary to use the present perfect tense.
feedback_suggestion: Change "is" to follow the present perfect pattern of have/has + past participle of the verb.

source: However, learning ideas and concepts needs more investigation and understanding [NONE] many of the academic textbooks.
corrected: However, learning ideas and concepts needs more investigation and understanding from many of the academic textbooks.
feedback_explanation: A preposition is required to show the relationship between "understanding" and "many of the academic textbooks."
feedback_suggestion: Consider adding "from" between the words "understanding" and "many."

source: Adam was twelve years old, a clever boy in his school, always got the top marks and participate in most activities, and known to all the teachers and students.
corrected: Adam was twelve years old, a clever boy in his school, always got the top marks and participated in most activities, and known to all the teachers and students.
feedback_explanation: It seems like this happened in the past, but "participate" is in the present tense here.
feedback_suggestion: Change "participate" to the past tense.

source: Also, it was the governors ' ultimate purpose.
corrected: Also, it was the governor 's ultimate purpose.
feedback_explanation: The possessive of a singular noun like "governor" is formed by adding an apostrophe + s.
feedback_suggestion: Move the apostrophe before the s to fix this possessive.

source: Now our company is going to do multidimensional operations, not just focus on furniture, but also on home appliance.
corrected: Now our company is going to do multidimensional operations, not just focus on furniture, but also on home appliances.
feedback_explanation: "Appliance" is a countable noun and can not be used in the singular when speaking in general terms.
feedback_suggestion: Change "appliance" to be plural.

source: They learn and understand very good English.
corrected: They learn and understand English very well.
feedback_explanation: "Good" is an adjective, but it seems to be modifying "understand." An adverb should be used instead.
feedback_suggestion: Use "well" instead of "good" to describe how an action is done.

source: Suddenly, a giant fish fell from the sky, causing him [NONE] spit out the hairball. Jack could not believe what he saw. The man riding the fish was Bugs Bunny!
corrected: Suddenly, a giant fish fell from the sky, causing him to spit out the hairball. Jack could not believe what he saw. The man riding the fish was Bugs Bunny!
feedback_explanation: When using "cause" to describe something causing another to do an action, the pattern "cause + person/thing + verb (to-infinitive)" is used.
feedback_suggestion: Change the verb to the to-infinitive to satisfy the causative pattern.

source: I have other qualities like, cooking like a super chef or even better than that. I am the most organized person in this country, and I love to work with children because it is a way to teach everything you know to other people and help [NONE] to improve as a person.
corrected: I have other qualities like, cooking like a super chef or even better than that. I am the most organized person in this country, and I love to work with children because it is a way to teach everything you know to other people and help them to improve as a person.
feedback_explanation: When using "help" to describe helping another with an action, the pattern "help + person/thing + verb (base form)" is used.
feedback_suggestion: Be sure to include the word for who or what is being helped.

source: We tried to gave her help but she was so heavy and we could not do that. Then we tried to find help,
corrected: We tried to give her help but she was so heavy and we could not do that. Then we tried to find help,
feedback_explanation: "Try" needs a to-infinitive (to + base form of the verb) here, but "to gave" is the wrong form.
feedback_suggestion: Change "gave" to the base form to fix this infinitive.

source: Anyway, those tribes would not even need or want an education or a world language because it is their way of life to live in groups together with the nature and disturbing these cultural groups would simply be unnecessary.
corrected: Anyway, those tribes would not even need or want an education or a world language because it is their way of life to live in groups together with [NONE] nature and disturbing these cultural groups would simply be unnecessary.
feedback_explanation: "Nature" is an abstract noun, so it does not need an article here.
feedback_suggestion: Remove the article "the."

source: There are a lot of high - rise buildings and it causes flooding along the high - rise building 's section.
corrected: There are a lot of high - rise buildings and it causes flooding along the high - rise buildings ' section.
feedback_explanation: It seems this should be a plural possessive, but an apostrophe + s ending is only used for the singular of "building."
feedback_suggestion: To make this a plural possessive, move the apostrophe to the end of the word, after the s.

source: That is why I totally agree with Richardson's modality dealing with this important issue which is present in students', schools' and parents [NONE] lives nowadays.
corrected: That is why I totally agree with Richardson's modality dealing with this important issue which is present in students', schools' and parents ' lives nowadays.
feedback_explanation: When something belongs to someone, it is necessary to use a possessive.
feedback_suggestion: Change "parents" to a possessive form to show whose lives we are talking about.

source: Secondly, I am so happy that you are glad with your new home. And what is it like?
corrected: Secondly, I am so happy that you are pleased with your new home. And what is it like?
feedback_explanation: It does not sound natural to use "glad" with "with."
feedback_suggestion: Try "pleased" instead of "glad."

source: To sum up, if you want to learn English, you don't need to go abroad. You can improve your English [NONE] working hard in your own country, for example, by doing exercises like listening and writing, or you can meet with native people who speak English to practise with them.
corrected: To sum up, if you want to learn English, you don't need to go abroad. You can improve your English by working hard in your own country, for example, by doing exercises like listening and writing, or you can meet with native people who speak English to practise with them.
feedback_explanation: A preposition is needed before "working" to show it is how the English is being improved.
feedback_suggestion: Add "by" before "working."

source: His advice helped me to increase the sales of [NONE] main e - retail partners.
corrected: His advice helped me to increase the sales of our main e - retail partners.
feedback_explanation: You need a determiner here - a word to clarify which main e-retail partners you are talking about.
feedback_suggestion: Add a determiner (such as "the," "my," "our," etc.) before "main e-retail partners."

source: He will deal with temporarily disabled people who came for a rehabilitation session every other day.
corrected: He would deal with temporarily disabled people who came for a rehabilitation session every other day.
feedback_explanation: "Will" is for the future, but this seems like something that happened often in the past. The "habitual past" may be better.
feedback_suggestion: Consider changing "will" to "would" or "used to" to make this the habitual past tense.

source: Another reason for being a graduate school student is [NONE] learn more practical knowledge which can be applied in my future career.
corrected: Another reason for being a graduate school student is to learn more practical knowledge which can be applied in my future career.
feedback_explanation: To express purpose or reason, you can use the to-infinitive (to + verb (base form)).
feedback_suggestion: Change the verb to the to-infinitive to complete the purpose clause.

source: He rushed from his bed to the street and walked to his way to see what he did every morning. When he was walking after the strange man, he noticed that he stopped at every trash can in the street to take a look and going to the next one. And, guess what? He saw Michael and ran away and Michael was afraid.
corrected: He rushed from his bed to the street and walked to his way to see what he did every morning. When he was walking after the strange man, he noticed that he stopped at every trash can in the street to take a look before going to the next one. And, guess what? He saw Michael and ran away and Michael was afraid.
feedback_explanation: It seems you are talking about one thing clearly happening before another, but "and" is mostly for things that happen together or around the same time.
feedback_suggestion: Use another word, such as "before," to talk about things happening in order.

source: There we visited the central park and we stayed in a very luxury hotel.
corrected: There we visited the central park and we stayed in a very luxurious hotel.
feedback_explanation: The word "luxury" is a noun, but we need an adjective to modify a noun like "hotel."
feedback_suggestion: Change "luxury" to an adjective like "luxurious."

source: I worked in a coffee last year in my country. I can work long hours.
corrected: I worked in a cafe last year in my country. I can work long hours.
feedback_explanation: "Coffee" is used for the drink or beans, not a place where you can work.

source: Higher power efficiency and linearity cause decreased power consumption, increase lifetime and reduction of interference channels.
corrected: Higher power efficiency and linearity cause decreased power consumption, increased lifetime and reduction of interference channels.
feedback_explanation: A verb like "increase" can not be used in this form to modify "lifetime." It must be changed into a participle.
feedback_suggestion: Change "increase" to the past participle.

source: It is true that water sports are not the most usual there, but, I enjoy doing them every summer on the beach.
corrected: It is true that water sports are not the most usual there, but, I enjoy doing them every summer at the beach.
feedback_explanation: "On" may not be the best preposition to use here. "On the beach" means being on the sand or rocks of the beach itself, while "at the beach" is broader and includes the water.
feedback_suggestion: Consider changing "on the beach" to "at the beach."

source: If you are bored with seeing classical museums, you can go to thematic museums such as [NONE] natural history museum.
corrected: If you are bored with seeing classical museums, you can go to thematic museums such as a natural history museum.
feedback_explanation: You need an article before "natural history museum." Since you are talking about any museum and not a specific one, use an indefinite article.
feedback_suggestion: Add "a" before "natural history museum."

source: Those people could be politicians, film stars, singers, football players and so on, living in constant stress because they can not have a 'normal' life, and, from my point of view, that's normal because they live for this, they are public people and, because of this, they have to keep calm and carry [NONE] with it.
corrected: Those people could be politicians, film stars, singers, football players and so on, living in constant stress because they can not have a 'normal' life, and, from my point of view, that's normal because they live for this, they are public people and, because of this, they have to keep calm and carry on with it.
feedback_explanation: The correct phrase is "keep calm and carry on."

source: The game starts with a ball at the centre of the field and them one of the two teams kicks it.
corrected: The game starts with a ball at the centre of the field and then one of the two teams kicks it.
feedback_explanation: This word may be misspelled.
feedback_suggestion: Did you mean "then?"

source: In my view, public transport will keep on offering their services, and will never be effected by the appearance of private means.
corrected: In my view, public transport will keep on offering their services, and will never be affected by the appearance of private means.
feedback_explanation: It seems you may want to use "affect" instead of "effect" here. These are commonly confused words. "Effect" means "result," while "affect" means "to influence."
feedback_suggestion: Use "affect" instead of "effect" in this case.

source: When I started to study here in Australia, I have been found the difference in curriculum compared to my home country.
corrected: When I started to study here in Australia, I [NONE] found the difference in curriculum compared to my home country.
feedback_explanation: This is in the passive voice, so it sounds like the difference found you. The active voice is better if you are the finder.
feedback_suggestion: Remove "have been" to make this into an active past tense verb.

source: Lima is among the top ten cities [NONE] have the messiest public transport in the world.
corrected: Lima is among the top ten cities that have the messiest public transport in the world.
feedback_explanation: It seems you are using a relative clause to explain more about the cities or highlight something about them. However, you are missing the relative pronoun.
feedback_suggestion: Add a relative pronoun to introduce the relative clause.

source: I really enjoy it because it gives me a lot of relax and it helps me to be toned and satisfied with myself.
corrected: I really enjoy it because it gives me a lot of relaxation and it helps me to be toned and satisfied with myself.

source: A couple of years ago, I spent a couple [NONE] weeks in Bright with Ef.

source: The person do not need to save large amounts of money to buy a car.
corrected: People do not need to save large amounts of money to buy a car.

feedback_suggestion: Remove the definite article "the" and change the word "person" to its plural form.

source: Michael went into the teacher's office, but he found that his teacher wasn't there. Maybe the teacher had gone to the bathroom. Michael felt excited but run out of the office, but he regretted his action. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.
corrected: Michael went into the teacher's office, but he found that his teacher wasn't there. Maybe the teacher had gone to the bathroom. Suddenly, the door was opened by a teacher, a teacher who was wearing a bikini came into sight. This incident came as quite a surprise to Michael. She flirted with Michael. Michael felt excited but ran out of the office, but he regretted his action. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

source: So, I'm really thinking [NONE] leaving this sport.
corrected: So, I'm really thinking about leaving this sport.
feedback_explanation: When referring to the object of thought, the verb "thinking" requires a preposition to connect to it.

source: She was so excited and happy. source: Public transport means travelling around the world and cities using trains, buses, taxi, airplanes etc.

source: Nowadays, every child can get more and more resources from their parents because of less competition with other child.

source: The most important step is inspect the notes to see which are good quality sheets and which are bad sheets.
corrected: The most important step is inspecting the notes to see which are good quality sheets and which are bad sheets.

source: Michael believed his mother, although he observed bruises on his wife's shape.
corrected: Michael believed his mother, although he observed bruises on his wife's face.
feedback_explanation: Bruises are often described as being on a body or a part of a body, but "shape" does not necessarily refer to any part of the body.
feedback_suggestion: Consider what you want to say and try another word instead of "shape."

source: In ten years, they didn't change that things, because they are delicious and no one would like to eat anything other than roast!
corrected: In ten years, they didn't change those things, because they are delicious and no one would like to eat anything other than roast!
feedback_explanation: "Things" is plural, but the determiner "that" is for singular nouns.
feedback_suggestion: Change "that" to the equivalent plural determiner.

source: Every months I buy my pass to use on the bus.
corrected: Every month I buy my pass to use on the bus.
feedback_explanation: Use the singular form of the word modified by "every."
feedback_suggestion: Change "months" to its singular form.

source: Let's take me as an example. I am a 25 years old girl who graduated from the faculty of engineering and wants to travel to Germany to complete my studies, but I am not able to do this because my family will not allow me to travel alone.
corrected: Let's take me as an example. I am a 25-year - old girl who graduated from the faculty of engineering and wants to travel to Germany to complete my studies, but I am not able to do this because my family will not allow me to travel alone.
feedback_explanation: When using age as an adjective before a noun, hyphens are needed between the number, "year," and "old."
feedback_suggestion: Add hyphens between each word to make this "25-year-old."

source: I'm a member of it and its goal is to improve the positivity of our society by setting up projects that serve many people who really needs our help.
corrected: I'm a member of it and its goal is to improve the positivity of our society by setting up projects that serve many people who really need our help.
feedback_explanation: The subject, "people," is plural. However, "needs" can only be used with a singular subject.
feedback_suggestion: Change "needs" to a form that goes with a plural subject.

source: On the one hand, Berlusconi compromised his position when some journalists told the world [NONE] some wiretappings of his which would compromise his future political career; on the other, Luciano Ligabue won the award for the best song of the year, bringing his career ever forward.

feedback_suggestion: Add the word "about" before "some wiretappings."

source: This essay will argue that genetically modified food can be the way out of the problem of food deficit and this will be done by focusing on its environmental benefits and increased food yield.
corrected: This essay will argue that genetically modified food could be the way out of the problem of food deficit and this will be done by focusing on its environmental benefits and increased food yield.

feedback_suggestion: Consider changing "can" to a less confident word like "could" or "may."

source: I would love to answer any question you could ask at this email [NONE], qq@gmail.com, and this mobile phone number, 666666666. I would be delighted to attend an interview whenever suits you.
corrected: I would love to answer any question you could ask at this email address, qq@gmail.com, and this mobile phone number, 666666666. I would be delighted to attend an interview whenever suits you.
feedback_explanation: Using only the word "email" here may sound casual or informal. The more formal "email address" may be better for essays and emails.

source: The river is in Toulouse is the Garona.

source: I am a 24-year - old male, and I love to do challenging task.

source: In the meanwhile, if people prefer to take buses or subways, there will be less noise in the streets.

source: Once upon a time, there was a boy his name was Michael.

source: She makes a great food for us. I like to cook with her and eat from her hand.

source: The next thing Michael knew was that he is making love with this girl.

source: In contrast, some people hate getting caught in a traffic jam, so they prefer public transport. Some other reasons might be rising gas price, car crashes or hating driving!

source: Peter looked at his watch and knew that he had to do something immediately that he has planned two weeks ago.

source: Thousands of acres of forests to be destroyed, leading to climate change.

source: To begin with, there are two ways of cutting down on pollution which leads to global warming, which has become a real threat to our life day by day.
